Field Label: Record ID
Staff make a concerted effort to welcome people in recovery and help them to feel comfortable in this program. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
This program/agency offers an inviting and dignified physical environment (e.g., the lobby, waiting rooms, etc.). Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
Staff encourage program participants to have hope and high expectations for their recovery. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
Program participants can change their clinician or case manager if they wish. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
Program participants can easily access their treatment records if they wish. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
Staff do not use threats, bribes, or other forms of pressure to influence the behavior of program participants. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
Staff believe in the ability of program participants to recover. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
Staff believe that program participants have the ability to manage their own symptoms. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)

Staff believe that program participants can make their own life choices regarding things such as where to live, when to work, whom to be friends with, etc. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
Staff listen to and respect the decisions that program participants make about their treatment and care. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
Staff regularly ask program participants about their interests and the things they would like to do in the community. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
Staff encourage program participants to take risks and try new things. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
This program offers specific services that fit each participant’s unique culture and life experiences. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
Staff offer participants opportunities to discuss their spiritual needs and interests when they wish. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
Staff offer participants opportunities to discuss their sexual needs and interests when they wish. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)

Staff help program participants to develop and plan for life goals beyond managing symptoms or staying stable (e.g., employment, education, physical fitness, connecting with family and friends, hobbies). Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
Staff routinely assist program participants with getting jobs. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)

Staff actively help program participants to get involved in non-mental health/addiction related activities, such as church groups, adult education, sports, or hobbies. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)

Staff work hard to help program participants to include people who are important to them in their recovery/treatment planning (such as family, friends, clergy, or an employer). Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
Staff actively introduce program participants to persons in recovery who can serve as role models or mentors. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
Staff actively connect program participants with self-help, peer support, or consumer advocacy groups and programs. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)

Staff actively help people find ways to give back to their community (i.e., volunteering, community services, neighborhood watch/cleanup). Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
People in recovery are encouraged to help staff with the development of new groups, programs, or services. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
People in recovery are encouraged to be involved in the evaluation of this agency’s programs, services, and service providers. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
People in recovery are encouraged to attend agency advisory boards and management meetings. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
Staff talk with program participants about what it takes to complete or exit the program. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
Progress made towards an individual’s own personal goals is tracked regularly. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
The primary role of agency staff is to assist a person with fulfilling his/her own goals and aspirations. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
Persons in recovery are involved with facilitating staff trainings and education at this program. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
Staff at this program regularly attend trainings on cultural competency. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
Staff are knowledgeable about special interest groups and activities in the community. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
Agency staff are diverse in terms of culture, ethnicity, lifestyle, and interests. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)

[For Administrators Only] This agency provides formal opportunities for people in recovery, family members, service providers, and administrators to learn about recovery. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)

[For Administrators Only] This agency provides structured educational activities to the community about mental illness and addictions. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)

[For Administrators Only] This agency provides a variety of treatment options for program participants (e.g., individual, group, peer support, medical, community-based, employment, skill building, employment, etc.). Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)

[For Administrators Only] Groups, meetings, and other activities are scheduled in the evenings or on weekends so as not to conflict with other recovery-oriented activities such as employment or school. Rate on a 5-point scale (1 = Strongly Disagree; 5 = Strongly agree)
